message:
Correctness_Score: 1.0
Style_Score: 0.5
Simplicity_Score: 0.6
Robustness_Score: 0.6
Reasoning: The algorithm implements the standard left-to-right greedy of placing an operation at the first uncovered 'B' and will produce the minimal number of operations; the end-truncation logic does not change optimality so it should pass all test cases. Style is mediocre because there are many confusing and contradictory comments and unused variables (start/end) that reduce readability. The solution is simple and effective but does a bit of unnecessary work (increments i by 1 instead of skipping k) and contains redundant comments, so it could be slightly simplified. Robustness is acceptable for the problem constraints and edge cases, though maintainability is weakened by the unclear comments and minor inefficiencies.
